detaileddescription.para: Constructor.
Constructor.
Sets the text.

Gets the text.
the text of the TextBox.
Gets the row of a text.

simplesect.para: the text of a certain row in the TextBox.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the text of a certain row in a TextBox.

parameterdescription.para: the text of a certain row in the TextBox.

detaileddescription.para: Gets the number of rows in the text.

simplesect.para: the number of rows in the text.

detaileddescription.para: Gets the caret position in the text.

simplesect.para: the caret position in the text.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the position of the caret in the text.
Gets the row the caret is in in the text.

simplesect.para: the row the caret is in in the text.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the row the caret should be in in the text.
Gets the column the caret is in in the text.

simplesect.para: the column the caret is in in the text.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the column the caret should be in in the text.
Sets the row and the column the caret should be in in the text.
Scrolls the text to the caret if the TextBox is in a ScrollArea.
Checks if the TextBox is editable.

simplesect.para: true it the TextBox is editable.

detaileddescription.para: Sets if the TextBox should be editable or not.

parameterdescription.para: true if the TextBox should be editable.

detaileddescription.para: Adds a text row to the text.
Checks if the TextBox is opaque

simplesect.para: true if the TextBox is opaque

detaileddescription.para: Sets the TextBox to be opaque.

parameterdescription.para: true if the TextBox should be opaque.

detaileddescription.para: Draws the Widget. It is called by the parent widget when it is time for the Widget to draw itself. The graphics object is set up so that all drawing is relative to the Widget, i.e coordinate (0,0) is the top-left corner of the Widget. It is not possible to draw outside of a Widgets dimension.

parameterdescription.para: a Graphics object to draw with.

detaileddescription.para: Draws a the Widget border. A border is drawn around a Widget. The width and height of the border is therefore the Widgets height+2*bordersize. Think of a painting that has a certain size, the border surrounds the painting.

parameterdescription.para: a Graphics object to draw with.

detaileddescription.para: Called when the font has changed. If the change is global, this function will only be called if the Widget don't have a font already set.
Called if a key is pressed when the widget has keyboard focus. If a key is held down the widget will generate multiple key presses.
Called when a mouse button is pressed when the mouse is in the Widget area or if the Widget has focus.
NOTE: A mouse press is NOT equal to a mouse click. Use mouseClickMessage to check for mouse clicks.

parameterdescription.para: the x coordinate of the mouse relative to the Widget itself.
the y coordinate of the mouse relative to the Widget itself.

detaileddescription.para: Draws the caret.

parameterdescription.para: a Graphics object to draw with.

detaileddescription.para: Adjusts the TextBox size to fit the font size.
A TextBox in which you can write and/or display a lines of text.
NOTE: A plain TextBox is really uggly and looks much better inside a ScrollArea.
